Reviews.Title: “relaxed high class hotel”
Reviews.Author: mf300
Reviews.Content: A really lovely place to stay. the cottage had a secluded feel up quite a few steps on the hillside. we had a real fire in our cottage which was set up for us daily and we used as it was cold. The restaurant at meadowood was a really special experience- although very expensive esp with the wine pairings but it does have a lovely ambience. make sure you book at the same time as reservation as it was fully booked (although it had just reopened when we were there). The evening wine tastings in the lobby were a nice touch and we also liked the grill restaurant, although a completely different atmosphere - mostly just hotel guests, the food was great and always there is someone on hand to recommend wine pairings. when we went into st helena, they took us in the complimentary limo which was great (although I am not sure if this is always available) The hiking trail on the property is quite extensive, we needed walking boots after the rain. A gollf lesson was excellent. Regarding the rooms I agree with other reviews that at this price the bathrooms could probably be more special, but we had opening windows on all sides as well as a balcony area- would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight is the restaurant and the service”
Reviews.Author: davidCorvallisOregon
Reviews.Content: Meadowood resort is well known for its seclusion and service and in both counts they do not disappoint but the infra structure is some what dated. Our cottage with fireplace is nicely designed but every thing is very old, with the bathroom a glaring example needing renovation, especially considering the high price the resort charges. The personnel and service are superb, no question but the other facilities such as golf course, fitness center, tennis and swimming pool are not that different than other high end resorts. The unique attraction is the Meadowood Restaurant which provides a truly refine finning experience of a Michelin three star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: cgodard
Reviews.Content: Meadowood is a special place -luxury camp for adults! Yes, it is expensive like the other reviews have said, however, it's well worth it. It's truly a destination unto itself so make sure you allow enough time to enjoy the amenities the resort has to offer -- especially your private cottage. Our perfect day is waking up early, hiking around the resort (quite a few trails) and then having breakfast at the hotel. We then will tour a few special wineries in Napa (Meadowood concierge will make appts. for you at any winery you want to visit - especially enjoyed Nickel & Nickel), have a late lunch at Auberge du Soleil (go during the day vs dinner so you can look out on the vineyards-beautiful), visit more wineries, shops or galleries, then stop off at Oakville Grocery and pick-up your favorite gourmet treats for dinner. They are renovating so we didn't get to go to our favorite grocery store this trip, but it's the best. Pick up wine, cheese, chocolate and anything else that looks amazing, then go back to your cottage, light a fire and shut the world out behind you. Aaaah...heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SAMDtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after getting a great deal through Luxury Link. The property is terribly expensive, but we found the rooms top notch, the property wonderful and the staff exceedingly attentive and helpful. The concierge recommendations were spot on and they were exceedingly helpful in getting restaurant recommendations. Don't miss the daily wine tasting in the lobby. We loved hiking the trails. If you are mobility impaired BE SURE to make that clear in your reservation because the property is full of hills and steps.We like walking and enjoyed the space, but if you don't I would make that known in advance. We did not make reservations for The Restaurant and wished we had, despite the price. ($$$$) This is a premium luxury property and we were not disappointed. If you can afford it- go.

Reviews.Title: “Over-the-top service”
Reviews.Author: jharper455
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meadowood because Schramsberg arranged a special rate for their Spring Camp. Even the special rate was still a bit high BUT we found it to be well worth the cost. Their service was unbelievable! Bottom line is we wanted pizza but not what was on their limited menu due to renovating the main restaurant. Bob, pouring wine for the evening reception in the lobby, offered someone to drive down to Tra Vigne to buy the pizza dough and they would make whatever pizza we wanted and deliver it to our rooms! It was some of the best pizza we've had. True customer service at its best! We will defintely go back because that is the type of exceptional service we all want. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Should have been so much better!”
Reviews.Author: GolingGal949
Reviews.Content: The Meadowood is located on a spectacular piece of property and will cost you a pretty penny. The rooms are lovely and well appointed and the grounds are great. (Although we can hear the vacuum next door at 7am!) The service stinks! The front desk was not attentive, there was no bell help, the restaurant couldn't accomodate us and we were staying there and we really didn't feel the love. It is a shame becuae it is a really beautiful place but I wouldn't fork out that kind of money for this place again. There are other options in the wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, how I love Meadowood!”
Reviews.Author: jennisyl
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at Meadowood and I can't wait to go back. This visit we stayed in the Woodland room and it was perfect. We love the wood burning fireplace in the separate sitting area. The setting is truly and the serene. I wish I could live at Meadowood. The service is outstanding. I look forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Distractions”
Reviews.Author: rreinis
Reviews.Content: Meadowood is a wonderful facility and deserves top ratings. But first the problem: when in Napa, the temptation to go wine tasting and sightseeing is strong. It takes you away from the neat little golf course, the hiking trails, the tennis courts, the spa and pools, the croquet, the fine food and willing service, and the shady porches of your cottage. You have two choices: (1) abstain: put your car keys in the room safe and forget the combination; or (2) lengthen your stay by at least 2 days and suffer the financial consequences: spend 2 days in tasting rooms or wineries and 2 days at the resort. Some might consider it a flaw that Meadowood has only limited food offerings and, at least at present, no grand entertaining rooms or intimate, wood paneled bars. I don't. If you want a spectatular, and really expenisve dinner, you can go out at night to any of the absolutely wonderful nearby restaurants. But then, you'd be missing the peace and quiet your cottage offers, something that cannot be said of every top rated hotel. In this case, I urge you to stay put. It is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: The accomodations at Meadowood are second to none. Our room had all the modern necessesties and more. While the facilities were excellent so was the staff and service. When you take this and place it in the magical Napa Valley setting...there are very few places that compare. Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat in wine country”
Reviews.Author: Boneguru
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in February and had a great experience. The room was very nice and well complimented by wood burning fireplace. Unfortunately the restaurant was under renovation, but the grill was great. The highlight of the stay was a private excursion with the Master Sommelier Gilles. Worth every penny and would definitely recommend to anyone looking for that special Napa experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: tpak
Reviews.Content: We got a decent rate by booking through our Amex Platinum Card, which also got us free breakfast each day, but it was still quite pricey. We stayed here the week between Christmas and New Years 2011, which is typically the low season in Napa Valley, but there were a lot of last minute bookings because the weather was unusually good (sunny and dry) and the weather up in Tahoe was also sunny and dry, which was bad for them. This resort is quite lovely and quite unlike any other place I've ever stayed. For one thing, the grounds are quite spread out (it was a good 1/2 mile from our cottage to the gym/pool area and 1/4 mile to the dining room) and everything is bucolic. There is a sense of peacefulness and privacy that cannot be replicated even in the poshest hotels. However, some may not like it for this same reason (if the weather had not been so nice, I don't know if we would have enjoyed walking so much just to get breakfast and do other activities). Our room was spectacular, with great views of the woods and surrounding mountains and a spacious bathroom (particularly compared to our NYC apartment). The gym is nice and the pool was heated (though we did not use it). The restaurant is fantastic - also very pricey, but worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to stay in the Wine Country!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi2go
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Meadowood and it impressed me even more. Our last stay was in a Treeline Cottage Room; this time was in the Lawnview Room with Fireplace. Both options are incredibly cozy, tastefully decorated and offering the best beds I've ever slept in. Although the Treeline Cottage Room may provide more privacy during the busier months, the Lawnview Room provides a lovely view looking out across the croquet lawn and golf course. And in January when we were there, it too is also very quiet. The resort is large and the grounds are gorgeous with several recreational facilities and over 4 miles of hiking trails. You can partake in a multitude of activities but be sure not to miss out on their spa; I had one of the best massages ever. Ask for Tamra! The resort is ideally situated right off the Silverado Trail where there are incredible wineries within a very short drive. The Restaurant was closed for renovations while we were there but is scheduled to open again in March so I look forward to that on our next visit. The Grill however was excellent. Meadowood is the perfect place to decompress and yet be close to a variety of attractions. It's stellar operation and itâ€™s wonderful staff deserve a 5+ star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Meadowood revisted”
Reviews.Author: samandjet
Reviews.Content: It has been a few year. We stayed in a Lawnview Alcove Room which is very close to the restaurant and main lodge. I believe the room has been renovated recently. The step down room with a nice sitting area, fireplace, terrace with the lawn view and super cozy bed. Service is great, resort ground is really nicely kept. They always have fresh apple, ice tea or lemonade in the main lodge which is a nice touch. We had one dinner at the restaurant, the chef's menu is to die forâ€¦. A true Michelin 3 star dinner experience! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property well-located within the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: tripindicular1
Reviews.Content: Meadowood is a beautiful camp-like resort spread well-situated in Napa. The setting is gorgeous. The location is great, close to St. Helena and several wineries. The rooms are nice and homey, but could use a little updating as well. We stayed in a Treeline Fireplace Room. They are large and cabin-like. Had an excellent massage at the spa, which could definitely benefit from an update. There are two beautiful pools, croquet, golf and lots of tennis courts. Service was good. Only had breakfast at the hotel which was good, but given the location, might have been more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “exquisite resort”
Reviews.Author: jv282
Reviews.Content: If you wine to splurge in wine country or if money is no object, stay here. It reminds me of the Hamptons of California. Such an amazing property with fantastic service. We stayed a Treeline Fireplace Room and it was so elegant, comfortable, and homey. The croquet court is wonderful and the restaurants are fantastic. A hop, skip, and a jump from all the wineries. A wonderful place for a romantic weekend. I hope that I have a chance to go back to Meadowood soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Alegria7CAL
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went last December to Meadowood for their "12 Days of Christmas" event and the hotel is as great as it was the first time I stayed there 10 year ago...actually, it is better... the Restaurant is fabulous, the rooms super cozy and great and attentive staff. Napa has a lot of nice and luxurious resorts and inns... but I still think Meadowood is best.l Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: L B
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent--the staff, the service, the facilities. All lead to a highly successful business meeting. Many thanks to everyone who helped make our meeting such a great success.

Reviews.Title: “Can I give 10 stars?”
Reviews.Author: ericamcarr
Reviews.Content: If you are in the mood for the best service in the world, go here. If you want a completely serene room with every single amenity possible, go here. From the initial introduction at the guards post upon entering, to the final emailed folio, every thing was spot on and above & beyond. The room we were given was at the top of 50 steps winding through open woods. A cabin or sorts with a front porch and a pitched ceiling. A stone fireplace welcomes you with a tall pile of freshly topped wood. The frette sheets adored the king size bed with plenty of pillows in various densities. The bathroom......ah the bathroom! A clawfoot tub big enough for 2, and a roman style shower and commode. The floor was heated too! When we returned from dinner, our sheets were turned down, slippers out on each side of the bed and fresh macaroons & bottles of water for each person. We slept the best we have in years, I'm telling you! This property has over 10 hiking trails and numerous other things to entertain, or to leave you to your self. We ordered breakfast in the am & is showed up in 20 min - perfect and delicious. Check out is easy & all you do is call down to the front. I'm so in love with Meadowood, I want to live here. Well done, BRAVO!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Two years later I still can't forget it...”
Reviews.Author: EcoFoodie
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service, excellent amenities, and beds you would never want to get out of. The hotel as a whole is exquisite, but it's really the people who work here that make it a five star experience. I have stayed at Meadowood twice (though not for 2 or more years), and still dream of my time here. And from what I've heard, it hasn't changed one bit since then. It's quite expensive, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Julia W
Reviews.Content: For the second year we had an offsite event at Meadowood and everyone raved. The guest rooms are incredibly quiet and very comfortable. The meeting room had great natural light and was perfect for our group. All the catered food in the meeting room was delicious and bountiful. Our dinner in The Restaurant was a singular experience. Guest are made to feel like royalty! You might think it's out of your budget but staff work to make it affordable and we're returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Autumn Wonderland”
Reviews.Author: florence S
Reviews.Content: 2nd fabulous visit with leaves and vineyards in full autumn color. The accomodations are special- woodburning fireplaces, fabulous bathrooms. The restaurant is a 3star Michelin- food as good as French Laundry. Food in the Grill for all three meals was excellent. you do not have to leave the property for fine wine and dining. Best location in Napa-outside charming town of St helena

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: HelloSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Meadowood Resort in the afternoon winding down a beautifully tree lined one way drive. Meadowood is gorgeous, the guestrooms and property are wonderful. The service we experienced was tremendous! The Michelin rated Restaurant was delicious! And the Fish and Chips from the Grill were a perfect lunch. We have stayed at this property twice and when travelling to Napa for a getaway there is not a better option. Plus the spa, golf, tennis and croquet are fun activities when you are not in one of two pools soaking up the sun. Also, the hotel is located on the Silverado Trail close to many of our favorite wineries. Donâ€™t miss Meadowood!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LMAC1967
Reviews.Content: We were so warmly welcomed to this wonderful resort and had a fantastic stay. The scenery is beautiful, the people are helpful and unobtrusive and we enjoyed the other amenities too. My husband and I both had the therapeutic massages and they were one of the best we've ever had. Fitness area and showers/saunas are great. We enjoyed a meal at The Grill the first night and The Restaurant the last night of our stay. Both were delicious and of course "The Restaurant" was an amazing experience. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: romanciaobella
Reviews.Content: Meadowood is a study in beauty and excellence. There is a culture of refinement and relaxation. The grounds are vast and stunningly beautiful. The lodges are perfectly designed to get the most out of the space and the optimum privacy and views. All the food, from the breakfast to the sublime dinner at the Restaurant exceeds all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: btexast
Reviews.Content: Lodging, food and activites were perfect. We loved playing golf with the antique wooden golf clubs and old style golf balls. It is expensive to stay here but if you can afford it you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Blueiguana
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at Meadowood last week. I had very high expectations -- they were exceeded in every respect. Our room was beautiful - tucked up in the wooded hills, felt like a private lodge, extremely comfortable bed. We tried almost everything that Meadowood had to offer -- relaxing massages, fun tennis lesson, hike around the property (just right -- enough to get the blood pumping but not overly difficult). A few highlights stand out. We had dinner in the Restaurant -- very inventive cuisine, extraordinary service. We booked a private wine excursion with the sommelier, Gilles de Chambure, and got a real insider's view of three wineries (including two fabulous small places that we never would have gone to on our own). And, believe it or not, the croquet lession was fabulous, something I'd never get anyplace else. Two things set this place apart from the rest. First, serenity -- everything about this property is calming. We did a lot during our stay and yet I left more relaxed than I have from any vacation. It felt like a private club, set out just for us. And the biggest asset of this resort is the service. Every single staff member (and there are a lot of them) seemed dedicated to doing whatever we wanted at a given moment. I'd give particular recognition to our concierge Bob, who set up all sorts of cool activities and visits for us. If you are going to Meadowood, definitely call a month or two in advance, and they will arrange fantastic winery visits, dinner reservations, and anything else you need. Meadowood is not inexpensive, but it is well worth the money. My biggest regret is that we only stayed for three days -- I'm ready to go back now.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: katy c
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently enjoyed our ten year Wedding Anniversary at Meadowood. We arrived on a Tuesday. I was really looking forward to the Restaurant at Meadowood and my husband just wanted to relax and unwind. From the moment we went through the entrance gate, we knew we were in very good hands and that no detail would be overlooked. We pulled to the reception and someone was waiting there for us, he brought our bags in. Checking in was over in a blink of an eye and we were off to our gorgeous room which stepped out onto the croquet lawn. The views from the room were great. The wood burning fireplace was spot on (even in the California summertime, a fireplace is nice at night.) There was a personalized note from Meadowood, welcoming us, along with tips and guides to the resort and a printed itinerary of what we had reserved for the visit. Not an overload of information, either...It was just enough to mill over. We went to the Restaurant at Meadowood at 6. We were taken to our table which had beautiful views of the hill tops which surround Meadowood and the golf course. Dinner was inexplicable. It was just 9 courses of incredible food and wine. The wait staff felt like old friends; so friendly and personable. It was a beautiful meal that I won't forget. The next morning, we ordered a hearty breakfast (which we enjoyed on the patio) before we went on a hike of the grounds. The hiking trails were very nice. They were moderate to difficult at the top without being technical. There was a group of turkeys that crossed our path and went on their way. Meadowood's hiking trails have benches (some, stocked with water) along the way to take a breather and enjoy the views. It was a lovely way to start the day. I had an afternoon massage at the Spa. The spa is by the pool so my husband lounged by the pool while I took advantage of the spa. It's not an overly extravagant spa, but it has all the amenities one would expect; a steam room and sauna, showers, lockers, etc. Really, just what you need to feel comforted before a massage. The massage was perfect. I was almost asleep, but not quite. We enjoyed the pool a little before we left. We were so well fed and rested at this point, we really didn't want to leave. Meadowood is a very quiet and beautiful place that I really hope to return to soon.

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: travelingbarbie08
Reviews.Content: Roomed in with a friend after walking out of La Bonita in St Helena. Was here for a wedding on the Meadowood grounds and it was beautiful. Rooms seen to all be in independent buildings scattered around the property. Our room required walking up about 25 ourdoor steps so, if climbing stairs is a problem, let them know. Amenities are not close by and even ice has to brought to you. But that is a small price to pay for luxurious stay. Rooms are very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ssramos
Reviews.Content: I live in Northern California and had never been to Meadwood before. I can't believe how private this place was. Lovely grounds, very nice ammenities, we even played a round of golf. Highly recommended for group outtings, family reunions, romantic getaway or even a girls weekend. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This resort has character, is unique and worth a visit but expensive and rooms are not large.”
Reviews.Author: writeholt
Reviews.Content: Although it is one of the most beautiful places in Northern California, the Resort at Meadowood is a costly place to visit. Special occasions might be the perfect chance to explore this full-service resort with pools, spa, tennis, croquet and a 9-hole golf course. Nearby St. Helena has the best shopping in the Napa Valley. Be prepared, you won't have a hotel room since the resort has unique cabin-type acccomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Vacation - Near Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Funeric54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with our son & daughter-in-law and our daughter and her boyfriend spent 3 wonderful days at the Meadowood. We stayed in a lovely room by the croquet field. King beds were incredibly confortable, rooms were spacious and 2 of our 3 rooms had fire places, which actually were nice to have even in August given the cool nights. The 3-star Michelin restaurant was phenominal and worth the price. Food preparation was unusual and delicious. Wine recommendations were perfect. Breakfast/brunch choices were plentiful and everything we ordered was great. Fresh squeezed juices were delicious and worth mentioning. Also, our children used the spa and all said their massages were top notch . Croquet was fun to play as a family and my son and I enjoyed the executive golf course. Recommendations of wineries was spot on, particularly the recommendation of lunch at The Grade, a tiny vineyard with excellent wines and a picturesque and lucious lunch. I will say that we did have an issue, but the manager handled it in an absolutely professional way; he addressed the issue immediately, provided no excuses, and provided more than appropriate compensation. We greatly appreciate his response. We highly recommend this resort and will absolutely stay here again the next time we visit the napa valley. BTW - we dined at Redd and Go Fish, both very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the wine country!!”
Reviews.Author: Virttraveler
Reviews.Content: By far i consider this to be one of the top hotels in the U.S., service, staff friendliness, accomodations, food, activities make this property a well deserved 5 star rating. This is a hidden gem in the Wine Country!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Donna D
Reviews.Content: Our Meadowood stay was fantastic. Our room facing the croquet court was spacious and sunny. The grounds are magnificent and the service is very attentive. Loved the spa and the golf. Hotel is located in the heart of the wine country with vineyards all around and the concierge made excellent suggestions. I would recommend Meadowood. Donna Rich

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY Place to Stay in Napa!”
Reviews.Author: portamiunagita
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Meadowood last night. It was exceptional! The service is flawless from the moment you arrive! Our room was stunning and provided amazing views of the gorgeous surroundings. I'm only sorry that we couldn't stay longer to enjoy their amazing tennis facilities. Be sure to dine at their 3-Michelin star restaurant - it's on par with The French Laundry!

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay! Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jhkcle1
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights here at the beginning of August. The accommodations in the tree top units where we stayed are simple but of high quality. The setting is beautiful. Excellent breakfasts and great atmosphere. The service is excellent. When something does need attention it is taken care of immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Gleneagles of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: olneygirl
Reviews.Content: What a fab hotel, expensive, but then I guess it keeps out the "rif raf" We had a Tree Lined Cottage over looking the pools. Very clean and comfortable. It was described as a 2 bed suite, but it turned out that our daughter slept on the sofabed, there was no seperate bedroom. Spacious bathroom - enough for 3 lots of toiletries and Molton Brown products - lush! Gym was fine for our needs, and seemed to be lots of classes to attend if you wanted to. Didn't use the Spa so can't comment on that. Restaurant was fine, good food, great service (we didn't visit the newly acclaimed Mitchelin star). There was a kiddies pool at one end of the lawn and a lap pool/adults pool at the other. I was a little bit annoyed one day, when 3 teenage girls were in the lap pool having the time of their lives, just doing what girls do best - having fun. They were asked to leave as they were making too much noise. The very next day, we sat by the pool and there were 8 very LOUD" ladies who lunch" working their way through the cocktail list and getting louder and louder - did anyone ask them to move or be quiet, no of course not, let them just disturb the other guests. So overall, if thats my only negative comments then iI'd say we had a fab stay at Meadowood. When we checked out, we were offered coffee and water for the onward journey, a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: RachinChina
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Meadowood for a quick weekend getaway. It was absolutely beautiful. The service was attentive but not intrusive. I had the most amazing hot stone massage at their spa. The cottages were so cozy that the only thing that dragged me out each day was the absolutely divine view from out french doors. We had the most fabulous driver who was able to make reccommendations for things to do while in St. Helena. One of them was to rent bicycles at the resort and explore St Helena on two wheels. It was unbelievably fun and Meadowood has great trails that you can ride bikes on. This was the one most beatutiful and romantic resorts that I have stayed at and I am hoping to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ever played real croquet?”
Reviews.Author: motAlamo
Reviews.Content: Meadowood has professional croquet courts and lessons. Friends hosted a birthday party there and about 30 of us took over four courts, had a short lesson, and then played two matches...what fun! They served an excellent buffet next to the courts and we socialized after the games.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a retreat and wine education”
Reviews.Author: edih
Reviews.Content: I did something out of the ordinary for me and booked this resort without doing any prior research whatsoever. My wife and I were going on an anniversary trip through California and we knew we wanted to stay in Napa, but we didn't have any good leads. I saw an offer for this resort and a wine excursion package on Bloomspot the day I was making all the travel plans and spontaneously booked it. One of the best decisions I ever made :) Although there were some initial issues with the Bloomspot discount offer (it was their first time working with that third party company), it all got resolved and our room (more like a mini house) was fantastic. It was on their sprawling property on the hillside and our room overlooked the putting green on their on site golf course. Beautiful view, top notch room, attentive staff that will drive you too and from your room to the main check-in area and restaurants. They'll pretty much drive you anywhere on the property, which comes in handy since there's so much to do there. Our highlight was the wine education that we got with our package. We got a one on one private tasting with Giles, their master sommelier. The next day we went on a private wine excursion to some of Napa Valley's best wineries. We got a great wine education and tasted some delicious wines. On the Meadowood grounds they have an award wining fine dining restaurant where we had several amazing dishes. All around it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary experience:luxury-fun-great escape-in the wilds+Mich 3***”
Reviews.Author: kifkin
Reviews.Content: We visited Meadowood with friends; played golf - only 9 holes but perfect- dressed in whites for tournament Friday evening croquet, followed by amazing dinner. We'd love to go back to celebrate a special occasion. The setting tucked into the oak forest and obsidian cliffs is awesome, with lovely gardens as well. Lots of birds. I'm an outdoor type, so this woodland area was particularly special for me. All the trappings of extraordinary attention to every detail plus world class food added to an experience I'll never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded Elegance”
Reviews.Author: TraceyMiles2
Reviews.Content: I was so surprised by the amazingly beautiful property. The staff attentiveness was above and beyond our expectations. And to find a restaurant of such high quality on-property is all but unheard of! Highly recommend this peaceful getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding retreat!”
Reviews.Author: Martini888
Reviews.Content: My first time at Meadowood and it was truly outstanding. The setting is so peaceful and serene...our Treeline Cottage room was in a beautiful forest with pebble paths leading all over the amazing property. The service staff was attentive and really seemed like they were happy to work in such an awesome place. Take a trip to Meadowood and relax in luxury...you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Two days feels like a weeks vacation”
Reviews.Author: KittyCat56
Reviews.Content: Meadowood has always been one of my favorite properties in Napa, but with the help of Janet Gregg, my client had an incredible stay and will be back for her vacation! When a business meeting feels like a vacation, you know you have a winner. Thank you Meadowood for making my job even better

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay on business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: cbonati
Reviews.Content: Meadowood is an exceptional property! It felt like an adult version of summer camp! The croquet lawn, swimming pool and spa were all outstanding and set this resort apart from all the rest. The meeting room facilities and the guest rooms were beautifully conducive to a productive conference. We can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property for individual travelers and small groups”
Reviews.Author: UberTravelerNYC
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing stay at Meadowood. The room I stayed in was so nicely appointed and cozy - like out of a Restoration Hardware catalog. I loved that the property had a variety of activities including a professional croquet lawn which I thought was really cool. The staff was extremely helpful and there always seemed to be someone around whenever I needed something. I think this would be a great property for a group or a wedding. All of the function spaces that I looked at were really lovely and felt very intimate. I also liked that is was not far away from town and all the other major attractions in the Napa Valley. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Every time we stay here we never want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: cschwabou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely love Meadowood. For the last two years my company has hosted our annual Holiday weekend at Meadowood and each year we have had the best stay. The rooms are so cozy and the whole stay is relaxing and serene. I highly recommend getting a massage while you are there and the croquet is a ton of fun. It is also nice to take a long walk on the many hiking trails. The beds are probably the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. Every time we stay there we never want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “There is NOTHING like a weekend at Meadowood”
Reviews.Author: ccallander
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky enough to frequent Meadowood now probably about six times and it never disappoints. The resort and its staff thinks of everything. And there is no off season at MW...in winter the rooms are cozy and warm with beautiful fireplaces and the most amazing beds! In summer, the grounds are beautiful and lush and the pool is fantastic. My particular favorite is to the hike around the property. We also had a fantastic dinner at The Grill. I have done stays at MW for both corporate and personal getaways and the catering chef if also a genius. The only negative I could possibly come up with is that once you are there, you won't ever want to leave. Last visit we sat in the lobby on Sunday by the fire and lounged there for hours over cider and cookies! It was all we could do to peel ourselves off the leather sofa and trudge back home.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING...Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Vaca35
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible time at Meadowood. The property was more then 5 star, it was impeccably kept and the service was phenomenal. I look forward to going back with other couples.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: FabuToronto
Reviews.Content: We went to Napa Valley to celebrate my wife's special 65th birthday! It was the perfect spot. The very large property was very well maintained. The service,ambiance and all the amenities met all our expectations The dinner in their gourmet 3 Star Michelin restaurant was superb. All the staff were especially accommodating. Our weekend stay could not have been better, even the weather cooperated and was beautiful and warm.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Romantic Place”
Reviews.Author: Chersco
Reviews.Content: Never having been in Napa, the opportunity to stay at Meadowood was so exciting!! Our stop before Napa was Big Sur. After driving thru the most beautiful wine country and farmlands, we pull into the estate. Passing thru the estate we arrive at the front desk and are greeted by very friendly staff who proceed to have us follow them to the 'cottage'. The grounds are so beautiful!! we walked down a path to our cottage which was PERFECT!! Lots of windows, living room with Fireplace, beamed ceilings; attention to detail was amazing down to the cream in the mini-fridge!! (not just powdered coffemate) Two adirondack rocking chairs with a table/umbrella on our own porch!! Have we died and gone to heaven? I think so!! The next night we had dinner in The Restaurant. The ambiance was fabulous and the service was to die for. Working out in the gym was great! It is great and they have thought of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, OK staff !”
Reviews.Author: lcf2001
Reviews.Content: From SF, we drove to Napa and the Meadowood. It's a Relais & Chateaux and the grounds are beautiful. Our room was very comfortable, big and casually elegant but a little far from everything. My only beef is with the attitude of the staff, especially compared with the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco, which was our previous hotel on this trip. Where as the staff at the RC were very polite and helpful with everything, the same cannot be said from the staff at Meadowood. A particular gentleman at the front desk was clearly misguided about client experience. Sadly he was not alone (the golf shop...). Would I go back... I'm not sure. With my kids, probably for the grounds but just with my wife, most likely I would go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful paradise”
Reviews.Author: duckleader
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 5 day stay here, what a wonderful experience. Don't miss the wine education class with Gille, the Master Sommelier, he is very interesting and provides an informative session for any wine lover. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and quiet with a lovely fireplace and deck. Go hike on the trails around the property, a nice workout. Breakfast at the Grill is deliciously memorable and great service all around.

Reviews.Title: “Engagement Trip to Remember”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere33
Reviews.Content: I took my now wife to Meadowood as part of our engagement trip. It was a beautiful place with good service and great views. Room was very nice, spa was perfect and the pool was idyllic. The only negative we found was "The Restaurant". My wife and I will always remember and laugh at our horrible meal at ghastly prices we had.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss - relaxing weekend in wonderful setting just what the doctor ordered”
Reviews.Author: Travel9898
Reviews.Content: What a most wonderful resort. Accommodations are exquisite, service impeccable and facilities wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Camp for Adults”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVancouver
Reviews.Content: Had the best time with a group of friends staying at Meadowood. I found the service to be mediocre But the experience was amazing! Bike riding, swimming, yoga, couples massage in addition to the incredible wine tasting venues! The grounds are gorgeous with suites nestled in the trees equipped with wood burning fire places. It is extremely romantic!

Reviews.Title: “As great as I remember it”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Huntsman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon 15 years ago and the service, ambiance, sense of relaxation were just as fantastic now as they were back then. Only regret is we didn't get to try their dining room which just received 3 Michelin Stars.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but...”
Reviews.Author: Balto99
Reviews.Content: Love this place, stayed 1/2 dozen times, but travelers should be aware of a couple things: 1)Tthe ceilings and walls are VERY thin in all the rooms. Demand a room on the top floor, irrespective of whatever building you are in. This was not addressed in the renovations. This morning at 6:30 am someone started walking in the room above us and did not stop for 2 hours. Place was basically vibrating the whole time. Annoying. 2) the server at breakfast was the most incompetent I have ever come across - mixed up drinks, mixed up orders, did not bring food, brought wrong food, neglected us. well you get the idea. Was beginning to feel victimized until we heard him apologizing profusely to the next table for same transgressions. In fairness, the service is usually quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccommend Meadowood for group and personal outings"”
Reviews.Author: dmwolter
Reviews.Content: Just spend 6 wonderfull days @ Meadowood. The first 4 for work, the last two with my wife for a bit of relaxation and wine tasting. The staff is fantastic, very helpful in both arranging group events as well as romantic trips. As expected, the wine list is fantastic, but what suprised me most was the food. Preparing group meals, lunches and breakfeasts can be underwhelming, Meadowood provided variety and an amazingly high quality. We also at at the restaurant on-site, which rivals or exceeds any of the fine dining experiences available in NAPA. I spend a lot of time in Napa, generally preferring never to stay at the same place twice, after staying at Meadowood, I think we've found our home in wine country and are already planning out next stay. Great location, beautifull property.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Silverado Trail....”
Reviews.Author: GoldStandard
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had a great weekend at Meadowood, it's our third/fourth time in recent years. We always enjoy the sprawling grounds and classic "All American" architecture-plus the rooms are very well appointed. The location just off the Silverado Trail makes it so easy post-tasting to get back to home base. We love that St. Helena is so close to SF, just a quick hour drive and it's paradise at Meadowood. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dalocopa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I dined at the Meadowood last week while staying at Auberge du Soleil, the five star resort down the street. We were greeted at the door by a friendly "host" who welcomed us by name. The menu was very small...either an 8 course tasting menu of what the waitress described as "bite size" portiions or a 3 course menu of not bite size portions. We opted for the latter and were shocked at the portions. The non tasting menu was literally 2-bite portions! I ate my asparagus wrapped in salmon in 2 bites and my chicken was a bite size piece of chicken breast and another bite size portiion of pressed dark meat. The cheese course was 4 tiny servings of overengineered bites on a 4 divider plate. Not only were the portions tiny but prices were high. I will say the quality of the food was good. The atmosphere was very sterile and formal. Another complaint is somebody came to our table literally every five minutes or sooner to interrupt us to attend to something...can I fill your water (don't interrupt just fill the friggin water, can I take your radishe-there was one tiny radish left on a plate..who is it bothering??) Needless to say, we were excited to hightail it back to our beautiful hotel and order some room service. I would not recommend this restaurant to anybody who is hungry...eat beforehand or to anybody who is looking for a peaceful uninterrupted meal.

Reviews.Title: “The room was like we were in an elegant treehouse!”
Reviews.Author: fitness_friend
Reviews.Content: The room was amazing! The staff was amazing! The food was amazing! There is nothing this resort won't do for you! They were fabulous and my fiance and I definitely enjoyed them. The staff, I just cannot stop raving about them! Wondeful job! The wine and cheese reception was much fun and the cookies and apple cider were delicious! Definitely a bit on the pricey side, so beware of that. The hiking trails were advanced - which is just how we like them - so we were pleasantly surprised! Lovely place in the wine country!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation!”
Reviews.Author: kevinwaz
Reviews.Content: I read the September review "Dowdy" and that pretty much sums it up. They may have painted the rooms, added a knick knack or two but the bathrooms are terrible. The grout on the floor and shower looks like it's from the 70's (maybe 60's) the ladies were glad they provided slippers as they were not about to walk on them it looked cheezy.. The fixtures are all old as well. The tub the sinks the faucets. Old Old OLD. Our room, I guess what would be considered a suite as it had two rooms, one with the bed one with a sitting area but it had no ambiance at all. We've stayed at the Harvest Inn before and they have fireplaces in each room and the feeling is great. The amenities in the room were fine, towels, linens, wide screen TV but no ambiance. Cold feeling. We ate only in the 3 meal restaurant food was good, service was good no complaints there and everyone was very nice. It's a little unnerving to drive through in the pitch dark to your unattached cabin style rooms and ours was a little treacherous to walk to which was down from the parking area about 5 flights of timber steps and lose gravel. Another 10 years in me and I wouldn't do that again. I just feel for the $700 plus room rate you should get more out of the room irrespective that they have pools, tennis, etc. Those are available at great hotels everywhere. Like I said they need to renovate (as in tear out) all the old stuff and get a decorator that understandszz cozy. This isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value--everything is dowdy”
Reviews.Author: DuniyaTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed in a Hillside Terrace room. We had dined at The Restaurant before, which was marvelous, so we were very much looking forward to our stay. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed. The room was dowdy--the decor utterly uninspired. The bathroom was all white tile with a dark-colored grout that resembled, well, dirt. The size of the balcony was nice, but the chairs were circa 1971 and the view was just a wall of tree tops. The other set of windows looked out on to the parking lot. The staff had arranged for a crib, but it looked like something from the early 1900s (and I don't mean in a nice vintage way). I called the front desk in the hopes of getting moved to another room. I thought maybe a higher floor would do the trick. The nice woman at the desk offered to have a staff person show me another room. I was relieved. But I was taken to a room that looked exactly the same, but was indeed on the second floor. We decided to stay in our original room. We asked the concierge to help us with a dinner reservation. She, too, was nice, but the restaurant she booked us at wasn't told that we needed a high chair (which we had specifically told the concierge about), and they didn't have any left. We had to scramble to find another place to eat. There's no question this hotel is centrally located, but the room is so outdated, that no level of fine service or amenities could make up for it. At these prices, I expect a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend with Kids”
Reviews.Author: chbj
Reviews.Content: The family pool, spa, nanny services and golf course allowed us to have a very relaxing family weekend in the wine country. Our room was clean, very comfortable. We felt like staying in a cabin in the woods. Overall a great experience. Like others mentioned the rooms could use a bit of updating. Also the spa is not as luxurious as a lot of newer spas are. To me those are just minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon paradise”
Reviews.Author: oepp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meadowood for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon and were blown away by this place. From the second we arrived we were made to feel so special and welcome. They had booked us into the wrong room in error but it was sorted out quickly and with many apologies, we were upgraded to a fabulous room overlooking the golf course and given a free bottle of wine and complementary transfer to our restaurant in St Helena that night. We ate at the Restaurant on our second night and it was one of the best meals we have ever had. Overall this place is magical, with wonderful service and we couldn't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “The trifecta -- food, spa & golf at one place”
Reviews.Author: richsf
Reviews.Content: We wanted to go somewhere romantic -- but not over the top -- for our 11th anniversary. I wanted to play golf, my wife wanted to spa, and we both wanted to drink good wine and eat good food. That ruled out Auberge (no golf course) and the Carneros Inn (too far south). Meadowood seemed like the perfect place. And it was. We reserved the "Art of Romance" package (which included two nights lodging, breakfast, sparking wine and chocolate on arrival, and spa for two). Our Treeline room was on the older side, but very well-kept. The bed was comfortable, and the room had a nice fireplace and seating area and a small patio for dining. While the bathroom needed refreshening (small tile floors, wainscoting, and some outdated lighting fixtures), the look overall was clean and classic. (A remodeled Treeline cottage was available, but at a higher cost.) I didn't want to spa, so my wife ended up getting two treatments. Late the second day while my wife was at the spa, I walked on to the golf course -- and had the entire course to myself. I played the entire 9 in just over an hour, and then replayed the first two holes again just for the fun of it. The Restaurant at Meadowood was fantastic. The food was (surpisingly) right up there with the French Laundry. Other notes: Service was excellent overall. E.g., we ordered breakfast from the golf course one day, and it was delivered to our room just as we finished our round. The wine director (and Master Sommelier), Gilles, gave us two excellent winery recommendations -- Viader and Gargiulo. The free handout map of Napa wineries is the best that I've ever seen. The adult pool was a bit crowded. Croquet and tennis courts were available. Overall, fantastic, and worth multiple return visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms - Excellent Service - Excellent Food”
Reviews.Author: themeetingplanner
Reviews.Content: I stay at many 5 star hotels and know and appreciate excellent service, well appointed rooms and good food. Meadwood has it all. I recommend it for a family or business person visiting the Napa area. We had a fireplace in our suite which the staff ignited for us when needed. Nice touch. Next time I will schedule more time to relax at the Club. Meadowood was recommed by a well traveled business associate. I would not have known about it without his recommendation. Worth the vist if you like upper end hotels that have excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially with children”
Reviews.Author: AnnieBibble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Meadowood for three nights with our two young children in March. We were very nervous about planning a trip to Napa with young children (23 months and 3 months-old), but it turned out to be a great time of year to go since it's off season. We liked this hotel because it felt like we had our own "cabin" but had the amenities and services of staying at a hotel. We used the nanny service recommended by the hotel and had a great experience eating at the hotel restaurant; the tasting menu was phenomenal and we really appreciated the care the waitstaff took to hurry the meal, knowing we were using a sitter for the first time with our infant. We ate lunch at the grill, which I do not recommend - it was nothing special and expensive. The rooms are a little "worn," but in general very comfortable; I recommend a room with a fireplace if you are going in the spring or fall (we used ours every morning and some nights). I can definitely say you will feel comfortable staying at this hotel with small children.

Reviews.Title: “At Home in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: LDarrell
Reviews.Content: After a busy school year and too much business travel, I longed to be in a secluded place with my family. I didn't want to travel far and decided to stay at Meadowood, a magical resort surrounded by trees, flowers and vineyards, offering discreet but incredibly attentive service. The pool area is beautiful and relaxing, lost among white roses, rosemary, and potted lemon trees scenting the already fresh, clean air. The gym and spa is a haven for a vigorous exercise routine followed by a hot rock massage and quiet reflection in the eucalyptus-scented sauna. We loved our room. It had a casual but elegant feel, the bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept on and the linens were as nice as the ones I bring back from Italy. With trees all around us, we felt like we were living in a made-up treehouse. We hiked, rode bikes, played in the pool and had to force ourselves to emerge from the cocoon of the hotel into the stunning Napa Valley. We tried a few of the famous restaurants and they were all good, but we preferred dining in the Meadowood Restaurant. The food is focused, delicious and innovative and if you sit outside on the terrace with the serene view of what feels like a pristine forest, you realize that you don't need to be anywhere else but there. This was the perfect place to shift into low gear and have the chance to listen to each other with none of the distractions of the tumultuous outside world.

Reviews.Title: “Best Massage Therapists!”
Reviews.Author: Brauna
Reviews.Content: We have visited Meadowwood with friends who are members, but this was the virst time that we actually stayed on the property. I agree with one of the reviewers that the rooms need updating. The carpet is warm, the furniture is uncomfortable, although the bed and linens were quite nice. No bathtub in our room, which was a disappointment. However, I strongly recommend the restaurant, which received, again, its two stars from Michelin with its new, inventive chef, Christopher Kostow. He is only 32 years old, and the restaurant, which seats only 44 people, has taken fine food and combined it with a relaxed, unpretentious manner. What a breath of fresh air. After the French Laundry, where you have to suffer through a long explication of the origin of the butter, it was such a treat to listen to people who know and love food as much as we do, without all the unneccesary verbiage. We also enjoyed the spa. I went to a very nice yoga class, and then my husband and I thought our two massage therapists, Erica and Morris, were fantastic. So, all in all, we enjoyed our stay, though I did lose my earrings in the room, and am sad that they haven't been returned.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: lisa11wa
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We stayed in a tree top room that was very clean and private. Restaurants at the hotel are awesome, The Restaurant at the Meadowood is an absolute MUST! Staff is very attentive, just give them a call and they will be there pronto. Spa was very nice. Just a note, get a car if you stay here or you will be dependant of staff getting you around. The grounds are huge and the rooms are scattered all over, which makes for good privacy, but a long walk to restaurants or the pool.

Reviews.Title: “For retired people who like golf...”
Reviews.Author: PandEKew
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, wonderful location. Food at The Grill for breakfast and dinner was disappointing and overpriced. Generally we felt let down by Meadowood - there was a lack of service unless requested - we even had to ask for ice to be delivered to the room. We came back to our room one morning after a walk in the grounds to find our door wide open and no staff in sight! There ia a wine reception in the evenings but what they don't mention is that there is hardly any seating and the lady running it had very little knowledge of the wine she was pouring. Overall a disappointing experience and not somewhere we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kalinak
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in a treetop room. The room was nice however pretty shabby and definitely in need of a remodel for the rate we were charged. It was nice to see the flat screen TV but overall it was somewhat of a dated room with pretty worn carpet and a musty smell when we entered. I did very much enjoy the layout of the room with the bedroom separated from the living area with a nice deck that overlooked the trees outside. I also enjoyed the close proximity to the pools. The staff are excellent. I was very impressed with their customer service. They really do a great job from check in to the poolside service. We enjoyed having dinner in our room but the food was not all that exciting. We traveled wth our one year old so we had to use the kids pool which was quite busy on Saturday afternoon. The facilities are clearly filled with local club members who bring their children to use the pool. The kids were out of control. I was even hit in the head with a football while holding on to my baby! The parents did not even say anything. They also were running around the lawns like wild childs and the parents just sat there. The club members I overheard talking are definitely snooty and think they are quite special. I did not get any attitude from staff who were always kind. Overall, it was not worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at Meadowood”
Reviews.Author: EssexBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends for 3 nights in July 2008 and all of us had a very enjoyable time. The chalet bedrooms are spread over quite a large area so there is quite a bit of walking to and from different parts and it may be too hilly for the elderly or unfit but we liked it. The service was excellent, and the rooms and facilities were all of a high standard and nothing seemed to be faded or tired in any way. There are separate adult only and family pool areas which seemed to work quite well and here too everything was very clean and well kept. For those who want to keep up their exercise the gym was fairly small but full of the latest equipment and the spa treatments were great. It's not cheap to stay here but overall I would say that it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Notes from a solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: BlondeandBlue99
Reviews.Content: My review will differ from most others I've read in the high end lodging bracket in that I was a solo traveler during this stay. On purpose. Call it an "individual retreat" if you like but the truth is I was looking to escape the harsh reality of a sad breakup and what better way to do it than to head to wine country. After an exhaustive review of the Meadowood website I narrowed my pick down to two flavors of room and a quick call to a very helpful young man in reservations had me reserved into an Oakview Lodge. This collection of "cottages" are up on the hillside nestled in amongst the trees and if you're looking for privacy - this is the ticket. I live in the Bay Area so it was easy for me to come fully stocked with a small cooler etc., and this worked out so well I literally didn't leave the room for two days, with the exception of a grocery run to Sunshine Foods and a drive down Silverado Trail to worship at the house of Rombauer. I did not eat at the famous restaurant. Rely on the other folks here - I've no doubt the food's wonderful. I did not swim in the pool. But it sounded like everyone else in the resort did. I did not partake of the spa. I did not play croquet or golf. What did I do you ask? I slept beneath the eaves of a cottage in a king bed that was as soft as a cloud, surrounded by no less than seven pillows and in linens so luxurious now I am going to have to reoutfit my bed at home. I bought a hot, pre-prepared meal at Sunshine Foods that was so good I am seriously contemplating making the drive to St. Helena to buy another one. Now this may sound low end, but remember I went here to *escape* and the thought of sitting in a restaurant by myself with an open bottle of Rombauer and a straw I didn't feel was befitting the elegance of this resort. So I ate in my cottage. It was the best weekend I've had in years. I wondered around in the gigantic white tile and glass blocked shower bathroom with the beautiful skylight and looked up at the trees. One night I lit candles and took a bath in the soaking tub. I sunbathed on my private deck one afternoon. When it got too hot, I retreated to the air conditioning of the cottage. I read all six magazines in the room. I only mistakenly placed the Travel & Leisure in my suitcase because it was the "Best of" issue.....uhhhhh yes, in which Meadowood made the list. My one gripe is the room did not have a DVD player which put season 2 of "Entourage" back in the case, but I didn't mind. I did visit the pool in the early evening where I was the only one there. It was heaven. In closing, Meadowood - in addition to being quite nice for the honeymooners and romantic-getawayers, turned out to be *perfect* for a solo getawayer. For anyone looking to escape the world and a large part of their disposable income - go. I will be returning. Maybe next time I'll even brave the restaurant solo.

Reviews.Title: “also a country club........”
Reviews.Author: ricky51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is also a country club so don't be fooled by only 85 rooms in thinking it is a small cozy relais and chateau;the country club members bring kids to the adults only pool and fill the place to the brim,so think twice if you are a couple looking for peace and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Great country club resort”
Reviews.Author: holidayjunkie007
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Meadowood to anyone who is staying for a few days in Napa Valley and enjoys comfort, luxury and great service. The service at this hotel was outstanding, I had quite a complicated trip to organise with my elderly parents and the guest services staff went out of their way before we arrived and during our stay to ensure that everything was organised. We hired a driver through the hotel who was excellent and very knowledgable about the wineries and the valley area. The hotel set up some winery appointments and the driver took us to some additional places, all of which were fantastic. The resort itself is huge but feels peaceful and quiet whilst having a wide range of facilities available. The rooms were lovely, comfortable and luxurious with a log fire set up each day just ready to light. We didn't have dinner at the hotel but if breakfast is anything to go by then I'm sure it would be delicious. My only complaint would be that I had an expensive spa treatment that was poor. Would highly recommend Meadowood and will certainly return

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and highly recommend Meadowood”
Reviews.Author: kimosabi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Saturday and Sunday at Meadowood and would highly recommend it to others. We had a junior suite which had a nice sitting area, a good size bedroom and a large bathroom. The room was beautiful and I found the beds to be very comfortable (and I am pretty picky these days with beds). We used the gym which had lots of equipment although my husband did have to wait a bit for a treadmill. We also spend the afternoon at the adult pool. It was lovely. I was surprised that most people there seemed to be locals - seems like a social gathering spot. We had breakfast at the casual restaurant and it was very good. The first day it was a bit slow getting coffee but other than that no complaints. It was fun to see the morning golfers tee off while having breakfast. We ended up having dinner in our room night after discovering Dean and de Luca's. We were able to get great wine there and we were able to pick up some fantastic cheeses, breads and pates. The other night we ate at the casual restaurant and had another fine meal. The woodsy feel of the place was great. We were in room 51 and there were quite a set of stairs to climb so just be aware of that if you have any knee problems or trouble walking. I found the whole experience to be great. We have stayed at Relais and Chateaux hotels before and this did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “More shabby, than chic”
Reviews.Author: inspiregoodBevHil
Reviews.Content: Nothing special considering the outrageous prices. The rooms are a big mishmash - we had a treetop suite. Bathroom purely utilitarian. Staff is uninspired and not particularly helpful. This hotel needs a kick in the behind with some serious competition.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Property”
Reviews.Author: mcbr
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are wonderful...hilly and lush. Our Treetop room was large, had vaulted ceilings and a fireplace. The bath had a separate tub and shower. I thought our unit looked a little worn but maybe it was because I expected so much after all I had heard about the resort. The bed was a little soft but had nice linens. We had room service which was excellent and on time. I became ill so we had to leave early and the front desk was very accomodating. I would probably stay here again, especially as I think they are redecorating the rooms. I loved the woodsy feel combined with great service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: samandjet
Reviews.Content: Two friends traveled with my partner and I to Meadowood for 2 nights. The land is amazing and service is outstanding. We loved the cottages that we stayed, they prepared everything that you might need for your stay. I enjoyed the reading time by the wood burning fire place and the wine tasting at 4pm in the lobby. We had a dinner at The Restaurant with pairing wines, it's for sure the best kept secret. Can't wait to go back to the paradise

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jessup
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meadowood for three nights during our honeymoon Napa Valley. Because it was a last-minute trip (our other honeymoon plans had fallen apart on the day we were supposed to leave) we arrived without anything booked except the room. From the start, the staff couldnâ€™t have been more gracious and accomodating. The concierge was especially helpful in planning a winery itinerary, suggesting activities, and making dinner reservations â€“ in fact, she got us into every restaurant we requested. The room was beautiful, the bathroom huge and luxurious and the bed was incredibly comfortable. When we went for a hike, we came across a box of ice cold bottles of water nailed into a tree. The hotel restaurant was delicious. The grounds were quite spread out but you could drive everywhere, or you could call to be picked up in a golf cart. The only downside (besides the price) was that the bike my husband rented from the hotel fell apart halfway through our ride (but they sent someone to pick us up).

Reviews.Title: “Meadowood Review”
Reviews.Author: ukrednek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meadowood for two nights in early September. We have two children (5 & 7) and stayed in a tree line w/ fireplace (because the bedroom is physically seperate from the living room). The set-up was great for a family and we were very happy with the accomodation. We found the concierge / front desk staff to be very helpful and professional. They arranged a full schedule for us and the children which we were very happy with. They have a seperate family pool which is great, as you don't have to worry about whether the kids are upsetting anyone. The restaurant was very good, with great service. Its pricey, but we thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Meadowood is great, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Redgirl13
Reviews.Content: Booked a small corporate group for five days at Meadowood. Our experience was great, although the price we paid per night made me gasp! I'm assuming the experience would be similar for vacation guests. The rooms are wonderful: lots of character, but well-maintained. The fireplace in every room (?) was great when I visited in October. What I like about Meadowood is that it is a beautiful property, well-maintained, great meeting space, great food, wonderful facilities (and of course a choice location near St. Helena), but in addtion to all that the service is down-to-earth and friendly all the time! The front desk staff, the banquet staff, and all the staff I worked with were top of the line helpful and responsive in every way. No minor detail was too much for them to handle and they move quick! If you go with a group of people, you MUST play croquet! Jerry, the croquet pro makes it fun and easy to learn. He knew everyone's name within 10 minutes. Our group had a great time, despite their apprehensions with the "dress all in white" rule. It was a great, no-stress team building experience. Our "happy hour" by the lap pool was one of the best social hours we've had, and the addition of a representative from a local winery to talk about their wines (Alpha Omega) and serve samples was magical (this was their idea). I highly recommend Meadowood as a site for your vacation or coroporate meeting.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Luxury Getaway”
Reviews.Author: sf_lux_traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in San Francisco and have stayed in many Small Luxury Hotels and The Leading Hotels of the World throughout Europe and North America. The property and service at Meadowood were equally amazing and second to none. Meadowood is beautifully tucked away in St. Helena and makes for a perfect local luxury getaway. Our room was very spacious with a private patio to enjoy the sun and the views. We had originally planned to stay for 2 nights and extended our visit for another...we just didn't want to leave :) Having been gone for only 3 days, we have come back relaxed as though we had been on vacation for a week. This Napa Valley jewel is part of the Relais & Chateaux collection and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -- if you can afford it.”
Reviews.Author: brendonla
Reviews.Content: DISCLAIMER: I stayed here 2 nights for free because my wife was working for one of the sponsors of the Napa Valley Wine Auction. We did pay for our food, but the lodging was free (well, she was working the event, so she earned it in my eyes.) That being said, this is a really nice property. Secluded. Quiet. Upscale goes without saying given the price tag. But not pretentious -- I have a low tolerance for going places where people are there to be seen: this is not one of those places (but when you tell locals you're staying here, they always say, "oh how nice!" as they raise their eyebrows). To get the most out of this place, you really need to stay probably 4-5 nights and use the pool, spa, tennis courts etc. We didn't have a chance to do any of that since we had a full schedule with the Wine Auction and attendant gatherings (dinners, lunches at local wineries and restaurants). Staff was very friendly and helpful. NEVER got any attitude from anyone on the property. Room itself was very nice -- like having our own little bungalow. Having said that, do I think it's worth $800+ a night? Eh, I dunno about that. But it was spacious, had a GREAT bed (seriously, the most comfortable bed I have EVER slept in a on vacation - I was tempted to ask what brand bed it was!), nice bathroom amenities, and a nice little patio overlooking the golf course. Yeah, the TV is small...but who comes to Napa to watch TV in their room? If you do, I pity you. The in-room breakfast brought to us was good, but frankly I've had a similar breakfast at the San Francisco Marriott that was just as good at half the price. Staff was great though: they forgot my orange juice and brought us 2, one on the house. Nice. Only gripe: we left our room the second day in the morning. When we got back at 3:30 p.m. to take a break and freshen up before dinner, the staff was still cleaning our room, so we had to wait in the lobby/lounge area for about 45 minutes until they were done. This kinda thing shouldn't happen on a property like this. Like another reviewer said: if you have cash to burn, by all means, stay here. If you're like my wife and myself and prefer to throw down $$ on food and going out and seeing the sights instead of where you hang your head, you can probably find just as good a room for much less in Napa.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great staff, quiet winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: alcw
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a couple to get away from it all. Great location in getting to other parts of Napa and many wineries, and not overly prententious. You'll need to make your own entertainment, but if you want solitude and isolation, this is the place for you.We stayed in February, when it was very quiet. The staff treated us like royalty. Extremely helpful in booking reservations for dinners or suggesting wineries. The fireplace in the room was fanatastic, the bathroom was one we'd love to take home with us! Our only problems were with the Wifi and the lack of cellular coverage without walking up the hillside. Since we worked partially during this visit it was incovenient but we managed. The staff worked hard to resolve our problems. The food on site was fabulous and the afternoon wine tasting in front of huge fireplace was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated Suites are Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_Dearest
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience at Meadowood, and it was quite nice. The property is huge, and lovely, with acres of trees and the golf course. It seems to extend over a mile or so, and a golf cart takes you to your individual cottage in the woods. My room was exqusite, with a private entrance, lots of windows, sisal matt rugs, a writing desk, flat screen tv, fireplace, and seating area with a soft throw blanket to drape over my legs as I relaxed and took in the beauty of the place. There was an incredibly comfortable King-sized bed with lots of pouffy sleeping pillows and halogen reading lights... A large box of complimentary chocolates awaited me, and I have to admit I tasted each of them quite happily ! The big, airy bathroom was wonderful, with candles by the tub, heavenly smelling shower and soap and lotion amenities, a wonderful large shower with both an overhead rain head and a wall head, and thick towels to dry off with... A soft bathrobe awaited me in the closet, as did slippers... Evening turn down service was a welcome touch. Meadowood is evidently in the beginning stages of an 18 month planned renovation of the property, and the suite I stayed in was one of the newest re-do's... It was exactly what was shown on the website, and I was quite pleased. Prices are VERY high, so do ask before you make a reservation, as some of the rooms are much older, and may not be as luxurious -- until they have been remodeled/updated. The dinner menu was superb, and reservations are recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: EBanks
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four days at Meadowood. Our stay was fantastic. The facilities and service were top notch. Our favorite experience was dinner at The Restaurant. Incredible food. We each chose the tastings menu. We also had dinner at Auberge du Soleil, and we found the experiences to be comparable. Daily breakfast at The Grill (on the terrace) was a great way to start each day. Beautiful views and excellent food. The pool is the perfect place to cap-off a day of winery visits. We plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fabulous service - lovely rooms. Our weekend at Meadowood was perfect! We had dinner at the Grill - a delight. Room service was fabulous & front desk staff was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Meadowood is laid back luxury”
Reviews.Author: Runnermom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon here in January 2002 and it was amazing. Very secluded. We stayed in an Oakview room which was a beautiful semi-suite with a gorgeous seating area and fireplace, enormous glass bricked bathroom and wonderful amenities. We were greeted with a gift basket and a local red wine as a gift from a family member and we enjoyed what is the best breakfast I've ever had. We hiked on the trail that encircles the estate, but didn't have a chance to enjoy the pools. Many people were playing tennis and enjoying the spa, but we didn't have the time to do all of that. We would have loved to stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: dcdude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two other couples stayed at Meadowood last weekend. I had never visited there, so I wasn't sure what to expect... The resort is nice. Fancy lobby. Nice, spacious rooms with fireplaces. Great beds. Spa facilities were good...and my treatment was amazing. I had a massage by Ignacio, and I was impressed with his skills. My sole complaint would be the food: We only ate one meal on site -- breakfast on Sunday morning -- and it left a lot to be desired. Maybe the cook was sick and they had a substitute? Hard to know...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: kspaulders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Meadowood for four nights and loved every minute of it. All staff were extremely welcoming and friendly. Room was a tree line cottage and it was everything we expected.
